member.name: T:Foxit.PDF.Cryptography.Aes128Security
member.summary: Represents AES 128 bit PDF document security.
member.remarks: AES 128 bit PDF security is compatible with PDF version 1.5 and higher and can be read with Adobe Acrobat Reader version 7 or higher. Older readers will not be able to read document encrypted with this security. Setting document version to lower values will throw an exception at the time of draw. For more details on AES 128 bit security take a look at the Security topic.
member.licensing:
This class is a Foxit PDF Generator Enterprise Edition feature. One of the following licenses is required for non-evaluation usage:
Foxit PDF Generator for .NET SDK Enterprise Edition
Foxit PDF Merger for .NET SDK Enterprise Edition

member.name: T:Foxit.PDF.Cryptography.Aes256Security
member.summary: Represents AES 256 bit PDF document security.
member.remarks: AES 256 bit PDF security is compatible with PDF version 1.5 and higher and can be read with Adobe Acrobat Reader version X or higher. Older readers will not be able to read document encrypted with this security. Setting document version to lower values will throw an exception at the time of draw. For more details on AES 256 bit security take a look at the Security topic.

member.name: T:Foxit.PDF.Cryptography.RC4128Security
member.summary: Represents RC4 128 bit PDF document security.
member.remarks: RC4 128 bit PDF security, with UseCryptFilter property set to false is compatible with PDF version 1.4 or higher and can be read with Adobe Acrobat Reader version 5 or higher. By default UseCryptFilter property is false. RC4 128 bit PDF security with crypt filter is compatible with PDF version 1.5 or higher and can be read with Adobe Acrobat Reader version 6 and higher. Older readers will not be able to read document encrypted with this security. For more details on RC4 128 bit security take a look at the Security topic.
member.licensing:

member.name: P:Foxit.PDF.Cryptography.RC4128Security.UseCryptFilter
member.summary: Gets or sets if the encryption should be done with crypt filters.
member.remarks: The default value is false. If set to true RC4 128 bit encryption is compatible with PDF version 1.5 or higher and can be read with Adobe Acrobat Reader version 6 or higher. Without crypt filter RC4 128 bit encryption is compatible with PDF version 1.4 or higher and can be read with Adobe Acrobat Reader version 5 or higher.

member.name: T:Foxit.PDF.Document
member.summary: Represents a PDF Document.
member.remarks: This is the primary class used to generate the PDF document. It represents a single PDF Document and is made up of Pages and Outlines. The document can have a object associated with it to control document security and encryption. The document can be output to any object derived from the class that supports writing and can easily be integrated with ASP.NET to stream the document to Internet Information Server's HTTP output stream.
member.licensing:

member.name: M:Foxit.PDF.Document.Sign(System.String,Foxit.PDF.Certificate)
member.summary: Sign this document digitally.
member.remarks:
NOTE: This method requires the .NET Framework 2.0 or greater.
To sign with visible signature, give the field name which is already added into any of the document pages. To sign with invisible, use a different name which does not assign for any of the page elements added into this document pages. Giving existing field name of other page elements apart from will make the document unsigned.
member.exception: If the document is signed more than once.
member.param: Field name of the signature.
Reference of type
member.licensing:
This method is a Foxit PDF Generator Enterprise Edition feature. One of the following licenses is required for non-evaluation usage:

member.name: P:Foxit.PDF.Document.CompressionLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the compression level of the Document.
member.remarks: A value from 0 to 9 indicating the compression level of the document. Six (6) is the default. Zero (0) represents no compression and nine (9) represents the best compression. This value will only affect the compression of the content streams of the documents pages. Depending on the type of document you are creating, it may not affect the size significantly.

member.name: T:Foxit.PDF.DocumentJavaScript
member.summary: Represents a PDF document's JavaScript entry.
member.remarks: For more details on using the document's JavaScript take a look at the JavaScript topic.

example.code:
Imports System Imports Foxit.PDF Imports Foxit.PDF.PageElements
Module MyModule
Sub Main() 'Create a MyDocument and set it's properties Dim MyDocument As Foxit.PDF.Document = New Foxit.PDF.Document
'Create a MyPage to add to the MyDocument Dim MyPage As Foxit.PDF.Page = New Foxit.PDF.Page(PageSize.Letter, PageOrientation.Portrait, 54.0F)
'Create a label to add to the MyPage Dim Text As String = "JavaScript Example" Dim MyLabel As Label = New Label(Text, 0, 0, 504, 100, Font.Helvetica, 18, TextAlign.Center)
'Add the JavaScript Alert to the Document MyDocument.JavaScripts.Add(New DocumentJavaScript("HelloWorld", "app.alert(""Hello World!!"")"))
'Add label to MyPage MyPage.Elements.Add(MyLabel)
'Add MyPage to MyDocument MyDocument.Pages.Add(MyPage)
' Save the PDF Document MyDocument.Draw("C:\MyDocument.pdf") End Sub End Module

member.licensing:

member.name: T:Foxit.PDF.EvenOddTemplate
member.summary: Represents an even / odd section or document template.
member.remarks: This class can be used to define a template that can contain separate information to go on even and odd pages. See the Templates topic for more on Templates.

member.name: T:Foxit.PDF.IccProfile
member.summary: Represents an ICC profile resource.
member.remarks: For more details on creating PDF/X documents take a look at the PDF/X topic.

example.code:
Imports System Imports Foxit.PDF Imports Foxit.PDF.PageElements Imports Foxit.PDF.Text
Module MyModule
Sub Main() ' Create a document and set it's properties Dim MyDocument As Foxit.PDF.Document = New Foxit.PDF.Document MyDocument.Title = "PDF/X-1a Document" MyDocument.PdfVersion = PdfVersion.v1_4
' Create a page to add to the document Dim MyPage As Foxit.PDF.Page = New Foxit.PDF.Page(PageSize.Letter, PageOrientation.Portrait, 54.0F)
MyDocument.PdfXVersion = PdfXVersion.PDF_X_1a_2003 Dim MyIccProfile As IccProfile = New IccProfile("C:\ICC Profiles\USWebCoatedSWOP.icc") Dim MyOutputIntent As OutputIntent = New OutputIntent("CGATS TR 001-1995 (SWOP)", "CGATS TR 001", "http://www.color.org", "U.S. Web Coated (SWOP) v2", MyIccProfile) MyDocument.OutputIntents.Add(MyOutputIntent) MyDocument.Trapped = Trapped.False
' Create a Label using a OpenType font and CMYK color Dim Text As String = "PDF/X 1-a Document" Dim MyOpenTypeFont As OpenTypeFont = New OpenTypeFont("verdana.otf") Dim MyLabel As Label = New Label(Text, 0, 0, 504, 100, MyOpenTypeFont, 18, TextAlign.Center, CmykColor.BlueViolet)
' Add label to page MyPage.Elements.Add(MyLabel)
' Add page to document MyDocument.Pages.Add(MyPage)
' Save the PDF Document MyDocument.Draw("C:\MyDocument.pdf") End Sub End Module

member.name: T:Foxit.PDF.Imaging.TiffFile
member.summary: Represents a TIFF image file.
member.remarks:
See the TIFF Images section for more details on TIFF File.
1. For handling TIFF files, always use TiffFile object class.
2. When using TiffFile object, always call the Close() method after draw method because internally the image stream will not be closed.

member.name: T:Foxit.PDF.Merger.MergeDocument
member.summary: Represents a document that can merge and append other documents.
member.remarks: This is the primary class used to merge or append entire PDF documents or certain pages from existing documents. The merge document can be output to any object derived from the class that supports writing and can easily be integrated with ASP.NET to stream the document to Internet Information Server's HTTP output stream.
member.licensing:
This class is a Foxit PDF Merger Standard Edition feature (NOTE: Some properties require additional licensing and are noted accordingly). One of the following licenses is required for non-evaluation usage:

member.name: T:Foxit.PDF.Merger.MergeOptions
member.summary: Represents options for merging PDF documents.
member.remarks: Currently the only merge option is whether or not to preserve the form fields on the PDF being merged in. Specifying true will keep the form fields on the merged PDF where specifying false will remove the form fields from the PDF.
member.licensing:

member.name: T:Foxit.PDF.Merger.PdfDocument
member.summary: Represents a PDF document for import.
member.remarks: This class should be used when you will be referencing an existing PDF document more than once. Using a PDFDocument is more efficient than specifying a file path because the document will not need to be parsed again on each subsequent reference. This class is safe for multithreaded operations.
member.licensing:

member.name: M:Foxit.PDF.PageElements.BarCoding.Aztec.GetOverflowAztec
member.summary: Gets a new instance of the class.
member.remarks: This method returns a new Aztec object that contains the remaining data that did not fit.

example.p: The following example shows how to use the GetOverflowAztec method to allow aztec barcodes to flow onto new pages as needed.
example.code:
Imports System Imports System.IO; Imports Foxit.PDF Imports Foxit.PDF.PageElements.BarCoding
Module MyModule
Sub Main()
' Create a PDF Document Dim MyDocument As Document = New Document
' Create an Aztec barcode Dim aztec As Aztec = New Aztec("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.", 50, 50, AztecSymbolSize.R23xC23, 5)
aztec.AllowStructuredAppend = true aztec.MessageID = "ID" Do ' Create a Page Dim MyPage As Page = New Page
' Add the aztec barcode to the page MyPage.Elements.Add( aztec )
' Add Page to the document MyDocument.Pages.Add(MyPage)
aztec = aztec.GetOverflowAztec() Loop While Not aztec Is Nothing
' Save the PDF MyDocument.Draw("C:\MyDocument.pdf")
End Sub End Module

member.name: M:Foxit.PDF.PageElements.BarCoding.Aztec.GetOverflowAztec(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Gets a new instance of the class.
member.param: The X coordinate of the aztec barcode.
The Y coordinate of the aztec barcode.
member.remarks: This method returns a new Aztec object that contains the remaining data that did not fit.

example.p: The following example shows how to use the GetOverflowAztec method with x and y co ordinates to allow aztec barcodes to flow onto new pages as needed.
example.code:
Imports System Imports System.IO; Imports Foxit.PDF Imports Foxit.PDF.PageElements.BarCoding
Module MyModule
Sub Main()
' Create a PDF Document Dim MyDocument As Document = New Document
float x = 10.0f; float y = 10.0f;;
' Create an Aztec barcode Dim aztec As Aztec = New Aztec("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.", x, y, AztecSymbolSize.R23xC23, 5)
aztec.AllowStructuredAppend = true aztec.MessageID = "ID" Do ' Create a Page Dim MyPage As Page = New Page
' Add the aztec barcode to the page MyPage.Elements.Add( aztec )
' Add Page to the document MyDocument.Pages.Add(MyPage)
aztec = aztec.GetOverflowAztec(x, y + 150) Loop While Not aztec Is Nothing
' Save the PDF MyDocument.Draw("C:\MyDocument.pdf")
End Sub End Module

member.name: P:Foxit.PDF.PageElements.BarCoding.Aztec.IsReaderInitializationSymbol
member.summary: Gets or Sets a boolean representing if the barcode is a reader initialization symbol.
member.remarks: Setting true will mark the symbol as reader initialization symbol and the size of the symbol should be one of the following, R15xC15 Compact, R19xC19, R23xC23, R27xC27, R31xC31, R37xC37, R41xC41, R45xC45, R49xC49, R53xC53, R57xC57, R61xC61, R67xC67, R71xC71, R75xC75, R79xC79, R83xC83, R87xC87, R91xC91, R95xC95, R101xC101, R105xC105, R109xC109, however it is recommended to set Auto.

member.name: P:Foxit.PDF.PageElements.BarCoding.Aztec.ProcessTilde
member.summary: Gets or Sets a boolean indicating whether to process tilde symbol in the input.
member.remarks: Setting true will check for ~ character and processes it for FNC1 or ECI characters.

member.name: M:Foxit.PDF.PageElements.BarCoding.Code128.#ctor(System.String,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The value of the barcode.
The X coordinate of the barcode.
The Y coordinate of the barcode.
The height of the barcode.
member.remarks: Code sets can be specified along with data, in order to do this property needs to be set to true. Example value: "~BHello ~AWORLD 1~C2345", where ~A, ~B and ~C representing code sets A, B and C respectively. However if any inline code set has invalid characters it will be shifted to an appropriate code set.

member.name: P:Foxit.PDF.PageElements.BarCoding.Code128.ProcessTilde
member.summary: Gets or Sets a boolean indicating whether to process the tilde character.
member.remarks: If true checks for fnc1 (~1) character in the barcode Value and checks for the inline code sets if present in the data to process. Example value: "~BHello ~AWORLD 1~C2345", where ~A, ~B and ~C representing code sets A, B and C respectively. However if any inline code set has invalid characters it will be shifted to an appropriate code set. "\" is used as an escape character to add ~.

member.name: P:Foxit.PDF.PageElements.BarCoding.Code128.LookAhead
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of characters to look ahead when determining the best mode.
member.remarks: This is used initially and when switching from Mode C.

member.name: P:Foxit.PDF.PageElements.BarCoding.Code128.ContinueToNextSymbol
member.summary: Gets or sets if the barcode will be continued to another Code 128 barcode.
member.remarks: If true a FNC2 code will be the first (second if IsUCCEAN128 is true) character in the barcode.

member.name: P:Foxit.PDF.PageElements.BarCoding.Code128.IsUCCEAN128
member.summary: Gets or sets if the barcode is a UCC / EAN Code 128 barcode.
member.remarks: If true a FNC1 code will be the first character in the barcode.

member.name: T:Foxit.PDF.PageElements.Bookmark
member.summary: Represents a bookmark.
member.remarks:
This class can be used to place bookmarks on the PDF document. These bookmarks will be displayed to the right of the PDF document. See the Outlines and Bookmarks topic for more details on bookmarks.
NOTE: This page element cannot be used within a table cell, or transformation group.

member.name: T:Foxit.PDF.PageElements.Forms.Signature
member.summary: Represents a Signature form field.
member.remarks:
NOTE: This class required the .NET Framework 2.0 or greater.
The signature can be of visible or invisible. Use this constructor to create a visible signature field. For creating a invisible field refer . A signature field that does not have corresponding entry at will behave as empty signature field and can be signed later.
The visible signature field is divided into three panels.
Left or Top Panel By default this panel holds the subject name of the given certificate.
Right or Bottom Panel This panel is set to hold information related with certificate and the signer.
Full Panel This panel constitutes complete area of the signature. It does not hold any default values, but can be used to show up full area text or image.

members.member: 1.Table width = first row width (or) sum of the cells width in the first row. 2.The top border width of the table is equal to half of the maximum collapsed top border. 3.The bottom border width is equal to half of the maximum collapsed bottom border. 4.Any borders that spill out of the table width(either left side or right side) are considered as table overflow. 5.Table Height = sum of all rows height + half of the maximum border width in the first row + half of maximum border width in the last row

share the table border width using border-conflict rules (according to the priority a specific border will taken to share between two cells as a single outer border). 1.Borders with the 'border-style' of 'hidden' take precedence over all other conflicting borders 2.If none of the styles are 'hidden' and at least one of them is not 'none', then narrow borders are discarded in favor of wider ones 3.If several have the same 'border-width' then styles are preferred in this order: 'double', 'solid', 'dashed', 'dotted', 'ridge', 'outset', 'groove', and the lowest: 'inset'. 4.If border styles differ only in color, then a style set on a cell wins over one on a row, which wins over a row group, column, column group and, lastly, table. When two elements of the same type conflict, then the one further to the left (if the table's 'direction' is 'ltr'; right, if it is 'rtl') and further to the top wins.

member.name: T:Foxit.PDF.PageElements.PageNumberingLabel
member.summary: Represents a page numbering label page element.
member.remarks:
This class can be used to add page and section numbering to a PDF document. A document can be broken up into sections using the property of the class. The following tokens can be used within the text of a PageNumberingLabel. They will be replaced with the appropriate value when the PDF is output.
Token Description
CP Current page. The default numbering style is numeric. The current page can be offset using the is offset by the property.
TP Total pages. The default numbering style is numeric. The total pages can be offset using the is offset by the property.
SP Section page. The default numbering style is the numbering style used by the section. The total pages can be offset using the is offset by the property.
ST Section Total. The default numbering style is the numbering style used by the section. The total pages can be offset using the is offset by the property.
PR Prefix. The sections prefix.
All tokens except the /%/%PR/%/% token can also contain a numbering style specifier. The numbering style specifier is placed in parenthesis after the token. If no numbering style specifier is given, then the current sections numbering specifier is used. If there are no document sections or the current section does not have a numbering specifier, numeric numbering is used.
Numbering Style Description
1 Numeric. Arabic numbers are used: 1, 2, 3, etc. Example: "/%/%CP(1)/%/%"
i Lower Case Roman Numerals. Lower case roman numerals are used: i, ii, iii, etc. Example: "/%/%CP(i)/%/%".
I Upper Case Roman Numerals. Upper case roman numerals are used: I, II, III, etc. Example: "/%/%CP(I)/%/%".
a Lower Latin Letters. Lower case Latin letters are used: a, b, c, etc. After z, aa is used followed by bb, cc, etc. Example: "/%/%CP(a)/%/%".
A Upper Latin Letters. Upper case Latin letters are used: A, B, C, etc. After Z, AA is used followed by BB, CC, etc. Example: "/%/%CP(A)/%/%".
b Lower Latin Letters. Lower case Latin letters are used: a, b, c, etc. After z, aa is used followed by ab, ac, etc. Example: "/%/%CP(b)/%/%".
B Lower Latin Letters. Lower case Latin letters are used: A, B, C, etc. After Z, AA is used followed by AB, AC, etc. Example: "/%/%CP(B)/%/%".
There should be no spaces within a token, only the token and optional numbering style specifier. This token is invalid /%/%CP ( i )/%/% because of the extra spaces.
Here are some examples of valid tokens:
/%/%SP/%/%
/%/%SP(I)/%/%
/%/%PR/%/%
/%/%ST(B)/%/%

member.name: T:Foxit.PDF.PageElements.Table
member.summary: Represents a table with rows, columns and cells.
member.remarks: This class can be used to create tables. A table must contain at least one Column and one Row with at least one Cell in that Row. Formatting of each cell in the table is done in a hierarchical manner in that a Cell's formatting take precedent over a Row's formatting which in term takes precedent over a Column's formatting which in term takes precedent over a Table's formatting . Using the AdvancedTables GetOverflowColumns and GetOverflowRows methods you can allow your table to easily flow onto other pages. See the Tables topic for more on tables.
member.licensing:

member.name: T:Foxit.PDF.PageElements.TextArea

member.name: T:Foxit.PDF.PickTrayByPdfSize
member.summary: Specifies how the printers tray is chosen.

member.name: F:Foxit.PDF.PickTrayByPdfSize.ViewerDefault
member.summary: The viewers default is used.

member.name: F:Foxit.PDF.PickTrayByPdfSize.Yes
member.summary: The tray is chosen based on the size of the PDF.

member.name: F:Foxit.PDF.PickTrayByPdfSize.No
member.summary: The tray is not chosen based on the size of the PDF.

member.name: T:Foxit.PDF.Prepress
member.summary: Represents the prepress settings.
member.remarks: For more details on creating PDF/X documents take a look at the PDF/X topic.

example.code:
Imports System Imports Foxit.PDF Imports Foxit.PDF.Text
Module MyModule
Sub Main() ' Create a document and set it's properties Dim MyDocument As Foxit.PDF.Document = New Foxit.PDF.Document MyDocument.Title = "PDF/X-1a Document" MyDocument.PdfVersion = PdfVersion.v1_4
' Create a page to add to the document Dim MyPage As Foxit.PDF.Page = New Foxit.PDF.Page(PageSize.Letter, PageOrientation.Portrait, 54.0F)
MyDocument.PdfXVersion = PdfXVersion.PDF_X_1a_2003 MyDocument.OutputIntents.Add(OutputIntent.USWebCoatedSwop) MyDocument.Trapped = Trapped.False
' Create a Label using a OpenType font and CMYK color Dim Text As String = "PDF/X 1-a Document" Dim MyOpenTypeFont As OpenTypeFont = New OpenTypeFont("verdana.otf") Dim MyLabel As Label = New Label(Text, 0, 0, 504, 100, MyOpenTypeFont, 18, TextAlign.Center, CmykColor.BlueViolet)
' Add label to page MyPage.Elements.Add(MyLabel)
' Add page to document MyDocument.Pages.Add(MyPage)
' Save the PDF Document MyDocument.Draw("C:\MyDocument.pdf") End Sub End Module

member.summary: A flag specifying whether to resize the document�s window to fit the size of the first displayed page.

member.summary: A flag specifying whether to position the document�s window in the center of the screen.

member.name: P:Foxit.PDF.ViewerPreferences.DisplayDocTitle
member.summary: A flag specifying whether the window�s title bar should display the document title taken from the Title entry of the document of the PDF file containing the document.

member.name: P:Foxit.PDF.ViewerPreferences.NonFullScreenPageMode
member.summary: Specifies the page mode when the documents page mode is set to full screen.
member.remarks: This value is ignored if the documents page mode is not set to full screen.

member.name: P:Foxit.PDF.Xmp.BasicJobTicketSchema.JobRef
member.summary: Gets the object to set. , references an external job management file for a job process in which the document is being used. Use of job names is under user control. Typical use would be to identify all documents that are part of a particular job or contract. There are multiple values because there can be more than one job using a particular document at any time, and it can also be useful to keep historical information about what jobs a document was part of previously.
member.remarks: This references an external job management file for a job process in which the document is being used. Use of job names is under user control. Typical use would be to identify all documents that are part of a particular job or contract. There are multiple values because there can be more than one job using a particular document at any time, and it can also be useful to keep historical information about what jobs a document was part of previously.

member.name: M:Foxit.PDF.Xmp.XmpWriter.BeginDescription(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Writes the RDF description for a given schema.
member.param: The schema namespace URI
The preferred schema namespace prefix
The rdf attribute on the rdf description element is a required attribute that identifies the resource whose metadata this XMP describes. Must follow URI syntax and may be an empty string.
